definitions.definition: An ancient Dharmic religion , with a focus on nonviolence and personal effort to elevate the reincarnating soul towards moksha by liberating it from samsara .
examples: Jainism is similar to other eastern religions in believing in reincarnation.

main_definition: An ancient Dharmic religion , with a focus on nonviolence and personal effort to elevate the reincarnating soul towards moksha by liberating it from samsara .
secondary_definitions: ( philosophy ) A nontheistic heterodox Indian philosophy
